intro: Ranunculus tripartitus var. obtusiflorus, commonly known as the blunt-flowered buttercup, is a herbaceous perennial native to parts of Europe and Asia. It features delicate, yellow flowers with five to nine petals, often surrounded by a ring of sepals. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with trifoliate leaves that are palmately divided. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full shade. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal in gardens and its role in supporting pollinators.
